summary: Adds a collection of lore-friendly, unique and useful Magic Items, sold by a few wizards, some merchants, or to be crafted at the forge, for a high price of septims or blood.
descriptionHtml:
Adds some more lore-friendly, unique and useful Magic Items to the game. That\'s my personal collection that I share here. The Items are as powerful and special as daedric rewards or other quest artifacts but they don\'t come for free! (1).

(1) except for cheaters but in this case I hope Molag Bal will have your guts for dinner.



[size=4][b]UPDATE[/size]

- Added 2 Items for Thieves & Assassins.
- Fixed Shied of the Elders: disallow unenchant.
- Fixed a few names (English v.)

[b]INSTALL:[/b] Extract the .esp file in the .rar archive and drop it in your Skyrim/Data folder.



[b][color=lightblue]SHIELD OF THE ELDERS[/color][/b]

- Type: Shield (Light Armor)
- Model used: Iron Banded Shield
- Enchantments: [b]SpellBreaker[/b]
- Recommended for: Warriors who hate Wizards and Daedras, by Crom! I made It because Spellbreaker\'s enchantment is awesome, the SFX is cool but I don\'t like the vanilla shield and Peyrite is repulsive.
- Acquisition: [b]Craftable at the Skyforge[/b]. Can be Tempered.
- To Be Done (i.e. not yet): Heavy Armor version.


[color=pink][b]NECKLACE OF SUPREME BEAUTY[/b][/color]

- Type: Necklace + Light Armor (base=5)
- Model used: Amulet of Dibella
- Enchantments: [color=pink][b]Light of Dibella[/b][/color] - CUSTOM! Find out!
- Recommended for: Thieves, but Warriors and Mages may find it useful too. Useful in towns & cities as well as \"dungeons\".
- Acquisition: [color=yellow]Belethor[/color]\'s Goods. Can be Tempered.
- To Be Done (i.e. not yet): Heavy Armor version + Female Only. On request.


[color=lightgreen][b]AMULET OF THE MIGHTY TALOS[/b][/color]

- Type: Necklace + Light Armor (base=7)
- Model used: Amulet of Talos
- Enchantments: [color=lightgreen][b]Champion of Talos[/b][/color] - CUSTOM! Find out!
- Recommended for: Warriors who like to Shout at their foes, or BattleMages.
- Acquisition: [color=yellow]Wuunferth[/color], Windhelm\'s Wizard. Can be Tempered.
- To Be Done (i.e. not yet): Heavy Armor version. On request + Stormcloak Player only script.

I recommend using this texture mod: [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/17078]Colourful God Amulet Retextures[/url] by Deanoman.


[b][color=grey]TALISMAN OF THE SILVER FOX[/color] - NEW[/b]

- Type: Necklace + Light Armor (base=5)
- Model used: Amulet of Articulation
- Enchantments: [color=lightgreen][b]Tricks of the Silver Fox[/b][/color] - CUSTOM! Find out!
- Recommended for: Thieves mostly, but also dishonest Mages.
- Acquisition: [color=yellow]Tonilia[/color], the Thieve\'s Guild fence. Can be Tempered.
That also means that you must be a member...
Note: I may transfer it to Gulum-ei so that It fits on the Thieves Guild questline.


[b][color=blue]RING OF THE DARK BLADE[/color]  - NEW[/b]

- Type: Ring
- Model used: Ring of Namira
- Enchantments: [color=blue][b]Dark Blade[/b][/color] - CUSTOM! Find out!
- Recommended for: Assassins and Thieves, also for cunning, subtle Warriors.
- Acquisition: [color=yellow]Farengar[/color], Whiterun\'s Wizard.


[b][color=cyan]RING OF THE WARRIOR[/color][/b]

- Type: Ring
- Model used: Ring of Hircine
- Enchantments: [color=cyan][b]Might of the Warrior[/b][/color] - CUSTOM! Find out!
- Recommended for: One-handed Warriors & brave Thieves.
- Acquisition: [color=yellow]Grelka[/color]\'s Shop at Riften\'s marketplace.


[color=red][b]RING OF THE BARBARIAN[/b][/color]

- Type: Ring
- Model used: Ring of Namira
- Enchantments: [color=red][b]Wrath of the Barbarian[/b][/color] - CUSTOM! Find out!
- Recommended for: Two-handed Warriors.
- Acquisition: [color=yellow]Sybille Stentor[/color], Solitude\'s Wizard.


More descriptions and items will come if I have the time + on request. Enjoy!

[b]Q & A[/b]

1) [b]Why multi-powered Items?[/b]
Because switching between rings & necklaces during combat is quite annoying, don\'t you think? Same in towns. Plus, they\'re like a magic set that fits a certain type of player. Don\'t you have enough carrying tons of trinkets or spending your days at the enchanting table?

2) [b]Why using vanilla models?[/b]
Because these ones look awesome, but they\'re used by weak or useless (or disgusting) artifacts. Who wants to be a cannibal, seriously. Also, the religious trinkets deserved a buff. It\'s like you\'ve been chosen by the Divinity! Now, I\'d like to customize the Iron Banded Shield I used with some colored gems... Anybody?

3) [b]Isn\'t that quite overpowered?[/b]
IMHO No, because they cost a LOT of Septims, preventing low level characters to acquire them + they require precious or rare materials to be forged and/or tempered. Ex: you may have to hunt some Ice Wraiths to buff your stuff...
Also, the level of enchantment is not the max you can get ingame, and all Items are unique.

4) [b]Why are your pics in French?[/b]
Because my game is in French but don\'t worry the main file is 100% in English. I\'ve put the French version in the Optional section.

4) Let me know in comments!
author: Didier47
